properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 3 at 2:51AM MST until January 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...VERY STRONG WINDS WILL CREATE GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS
AROUND ARLINGTON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...

* WHAT...Ground blizzard conditions expected. Total snow
accumulations of up to one inch. Winds increasing tonight
approaching 60 mph by early morning Friday. Gusts as high as
70 mph late Friday morning through Friday evening. Fresh snow
from the snow storm on New Years Day of 7 to 11 inches will be
blown around by these very strong winds creating white out
conditions.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 from Arlington to Elk Mountain.

* WHEN...From 3 AM Friday to 5 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slick and icy road conditions. Widespread
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could make travel difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If possible...cancel your travel plans if
traveling Interstate 80 between Rawlins and Laramie. Travel
will become impossible through this stretch of Interstate 80.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY
